snippet.title: Battle of Shiloh - 1981 - Apple II
snippet.description:
Another great game from SSI. Battle of Shiloh is very similar to Tigers in the Snow and they are both probably were made with the same engine. Therefore my comments are similar to that game: gamplay is enjoyable, the graphics are pleasant for 1981, especially compared to the Avalon Hill wargames that existed in 1980-1981.

In the video I play with the Union forces. I try to establish a defensive line in the north and retreat on the eastern front. Defending the north was a bad idea. First, I did not expect that there are reinforcements coming in  from further north. Second, separating the eastern and northern units it makes the north vulnerable to encirclement. This is something I should have calculated with.

On the east my initial steps are comparably bad because my retreat is too slow. I had the idea that was better to hold the enemy and to cause losses gradually then to do a full blown retreat. However I was unable to build any pockets to achive this, and I loose some units instead. 

Realizing my mistakes I quickly build a defensive line on the east which results in my first small victories. Unfortunatelly I had to end the video here.
